alert.note: Alert for Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Jeff Davis and southeastern Culberson Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 415 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Kent, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kent. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 166 and 178. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
